info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 1:10PM EDT until July 30 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson KY
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following county, Bell.
* WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 108 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Minor flooding of small streams and creeks, roads, and roadside culverts is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cannon Creek, Little Clear Creek, Lick Fork, Yellow Creek, Bens Fork, Greasy Creek, Clear Creek and Hignite Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Davisburg, Ingram and Clear Creek Springs.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
